title: What is Gulp?

options.b: A task runner that automates repetitive development tasks

title: What is the primary purpose of Gulp?

options.b: To automate tasks like minification, compilation, and more in web development

title: Which programming language is commonly used to write Gulp tasks?

options.b: JavaScript

title: What does a Gulp task typically consist of?

options.b: A set of functions that define the tasks to be performed

title: In Gulp, what is a 'Gulpfile'?

options.a: A configuration file for web servers
options.b: A script that defines Gulp tasks and their execution
options.d: A document containing web design guidelines

title: What is the purpose of 'gulp.src' in a Gulp task?

options.b: To specify the target file for a Gulp task
options.c: To read files from the file system and create a stream
options.d: To source fonts for a web page

title: What is 'pipe' used for in Gulp?

options.b: To transfer data between two Gulp tasks

title: Which of the following is a common task performed using Gulp?

options.b: Image processing

title: In Gulp, what does 'gulp.dest' do?

options.b: To deploy the project to a server
options.c: To specify the output destination for processed files

title: What is the purpose of 'gulp.watch' in Gulp?

options.b: To monitor changes in specified files and trigger tasks in response

title: What is a Gulp plugin?

options.b: A third-party JavaScript module that provides additional functionality for Gulp tasks

title: Which of the following is a common Gulp plugin used for minifying JavaScript files?

options.b: gulp-minify

title: What is the purpose of 'gulp-concat' in Gulp?

options.a: To divide tasks into smaller subtasks
options.b: To concatenate (combine) multiple files into one

title: What is the primary benefit of using Gulp in web development?

options.a: To make web applications more interactive
options.b: To automate repetitive tasks, saving time and effort

title: In Gulp, what is a 'task runner'?

options.a: A tool for deploying web applications
options.b: A build system that automates the execution of Gulp tasks
options.d: A web framework for server-side development

title: Which Gulp command is used to execute a specific task?

options.b: gulp go

title: What is the purpose of the 'gulp-clean' plugin in Gulp?

options.b: To optimize images
options.c: To generate CSS from SASS files
options.d: To serve a development version of a web application

title: In Gulp, what is the role of 'gulp-livereload'?

options.a: To reload the browser automatically when changes are made to the project files
options.b: To compress images

title: Which of the following is a Gulp plugin used for optimizing images?

options.b: gulp-imager

title: What is the purpose of 'gulp-autoprefixer' in Gulp?

options.a: To add prefixes to CSS properties for better browser compatibility
options.b: To automate server deployment
options.c: To create an automated testing suite

title: In Gulp, what is the 'gulp-rename' plugin used for?

options.b: To rename JavaScript variables

title: What does 'gulp-sass' do in Gulp?

options.b: To compile SASS/SCSS files into CSS

title: In Gulp, what is the purpose of 'gulp-babel'?

options.b: To transpile JavaScript code to a version compatible with various browsers

title: What is the purpose of the 'gulp-clean-css' plugin in Gulp?

options.b: To optimize images
options.c: To minify and clean up CSS code

title: In Gulp, what is the role of 'gulp-eslint'?

options.b: To manage project dependencies
options.c: To analyze JavaScript code for potential errors and style issues

title: What is the purpose of 'gulp-uglifycss' in Gulp?

options.b: To uglify (minify) JavaScript code
options.c: To create ugly and unreadable code

title: In Gulp, what is the 'gulp-svgmin' plugin used for?

options.b: To convert SVG files to PNG

title: What does 'gulp-htmlmin' do in Gulp?

options.b: To convert HTML to Markdown
